title: Randomness and Bell's Inequality [Audio only]
description: In this episode, we discuss what makes an event random, and how incredible it is what Bell's theorem (or inequality) has to say about truly random events. Note: "local" means that information from the hidden variable doesn't travel faster than light. The paper "On the Einstein Podolsky Rosen Paradox" is available here: http://www.drchinese.com/David/BellC... http://homepages.physik.uni-muenchen.de/~vondelft/Lehre/09qm/lec21-22-BellInequalities/Bell1964.pdf.
